intro: Stoebe passerinoides, commonly known as narrowleaf sandroot, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in prairie and open woodland habitats. It has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Stoebe passerinoides is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native range.
